relation: Total number of discards during the load
Number of discards from the current file
Whether save data points are used
textBeforeTable: FILEXT$ FILEXT$ is created the first time you turn on the AUTOEXTEND characteristic for a datafile. Table Descriptions This section lists the columns and public synonyms for the dynamic performance tables. For more information, see Oracle7 Server Utilities. Granting Access on Selected Tables If any user other than SYS wants to use Server Manager's MONITOR functions, that user needs access to one or more of the dynamic performance tables. For information on running UTLMONTR.SQL on your system, see your operating system specific Oracle documentation. Granting Access to All Tables The UTLMONTR.SQL script can be run to grant access to PUBLIC on all of the dynamic performance tables needed to view MONITOR displays. Access to the Dynamic Performance Tables After installation, only username SYS has access to the dynamic performance tables. However, access to these tables is required for any user needing to view the MONITOR displays available in command-line mode of Server Manager. Warning: Information about the dynamic performance tables is presented for completeness only; this information does not imply a commitment to support these tables in the future. Suggestion: Once the instance is started, the V$ views are accessible. The database does not have to be mounted or open. One important consequence of this fact is that the V$LOG view can be used to identify log files
textAfterTable: Represents This SID NUMBER Session number that is accessing an object OWNER VARCHAR2 Owner of the object OBJECT VARCHAR2 Name of the object OB_TYP NUMBER Type identifier for the object V$ACTIVE_INSTANCES This view maps instance names to instance numbers for all instances that have the database currently mounted. This Column Datatype Represents This INST_NUMBER NUMBER The instance number INST_NAME VARCHAR2(60) The instance name V$ARCHIVE This view contains information on archive logs for each thread in the database system. Each row provides information for one thread. This Column Datatype Represents This GROUP# NUMBER Log file group number THREAD# NUMBER Log file thread number SEQUENCE# NUMBER Log file
